lines.gurmukhi: crn srin gur BeI inhcl miq mn aunmn ilv shj smwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Sarani Gur Bhaee Nihachal Mati , Man Ounaman Liv Sahaj Samaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the refuge of Satguru the intellect becomes stable. The mind attaches itself with state divine and rests in equipoise.

lines.gurmukhi: diRsit drs Aru sbd suriq imil prmdBuq pRym nym aupjwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Drisati Daras Aru Sabad Surati Mili , Paramadabhout Praym Naym Oupajaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: With the mind engrossing into the teachings of Satguru and divine word residing for ever in the memory, astonishing loving devotion is generated.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK swDsMg rMg huie qMbol rs pwrs pris Dwqu kMcn idKwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gursikh Saadhasang Rang Hui Tanbol Rasa , Paaras Parasi Dhaatu Kanchan Dikhaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the company of devoted, slave Sikhs, noble and pious persons, one gets dyed in the hue of colour as beetle leaf, beetle nut, lime, cardamom and catechu mix together to become red beside giving pleasant smell. As other metals become gold when touched wi

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn sugMD sMD bwsnw subws qws AkQ kQw ibnod khq n Awey hY ]85]
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Sougandh Sandh Baasanaa Soubaas Taasa , Akad Kadaa Binod Kahat N Aaay Hai ?85?

Shabad OS B.translation: As the fragrance of sandalwood makes other trees equally fragrant, so does the touch of the holy feet, a glimpse of the True Guru, and with' the union of the divine word and the conscious mind; the company of pious and noble persons, fragrance blossoms. T
